qas.question: What language does the word "symbiosis" come from?
What type of organism did Frank apply the term "symbiosis" to?
What nationality was Heinrich Anton de Bary?
What nationality was Albert Bernhard Frank?
When did Heinrich Anton de Bary discover lichens?
When was the the word "symbiosis" discovered?
What year did Heinrich Anton de Bary become a mycologist?
What year did Albert Bernhard Frank agree to define "symbiosis" as "the living together of unlike organisms."?

context: Symbiosis (from <a0_0>Greek<a0_0/> σύν "together" and βίωσις "living") is close and often long-term interaction between two different biological species. In <b5_0>1877<b5_0/> Albert Bernhard Frank used the word symbiosis (which previously had been used to depict people living together in community) to describe the mutualistic relationship in <a1_0>lichens<a1_0/>. In <b4_0><b6_0><b7_0>1879<b7_0/><b6_0/><b4_0/>, the <a2_0><b3_0>German<b3_0/><a2_0/> mycologist Heinrich Anton de Bary defined it as "the living together of unlike organisms."
